sourceMeaningMnemonic: Someone just asked you to <radical>say</radical> which <radical>direction</radical> they should <kanji>visit</kanji>.
meaningInfo: You better think long and hard about where you think they should visit before you say so. They're relying on you.
readingMnemonic: You end up saying, "You should <kanji>visit</kanji> my <reading>ho</reading>me (<ja>ほう</ja>)." How kind of you!
readingInfo: Your home is just over that direction, and it's your favorite place to visit, so why wouldn't this stranger want to visit your home too?! So come and visit my home, random person!
